page.title: 16RELIGION Pentney & Narboro'
page.content: Pentney and Narborough each have a {Parish Church}and share the same Priest. Generally 1 or 2 services are held in each Church every Sunday, plus occasional midweek ones. Fair sized congregations attend both. A{Junior {Church}flourishes in both parishes. {Treasure Trove}in the form of 5 silver brooches (98% silver) was found in Pentney Churchyard in 1977. They were valued at Â£135,000. Pentney has a {Baptist Chapel}built in 1931. There are two services a month often held by lay preachers. Narborough has a {Methodist Church}with a service each week. In both cases the Minister in charge is situated in King's Lynn. A {Newsletter,}written by the Vicar, is issued every week and contains a Bible text and message plus his own letter and news of parish events.
